ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about psychoanalytic theory and Black feminist and queer theory  WGSS and ER&M classes Id been in previously hadnt taught me as much as this class did.

This class teaches you to critically engage with theories about subjectivity (from a feminist, queer, and black studies perspective) ! We looked at how subjectivity is constituted and how it interacts with social systems / identity positions. This is the first class I've taken that looks at this topic -- I think it is super helpful for WGSS majors as these themes pop up a ton in readings and may be hard to understand without a class like this with gives background on psychoanalytic and affect theories.
I was introduced to a wealth of knowledge explaining to me how to position myself in the world, showing me how I got here, and how I can continue to move forward. I also learned how to read theory!!!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: All strengths! I loved how Prof Lewis set up the syllabus and provided us each week with guiding questions for the readings so we could orient ourselves. She herself was a lovely and very supportive professor. She made space for every student in a way that Ive never experienced before.

Prof. Lewis does such a good job at facilitating discussion and creating a learning environment. All of the readings we've done for this class have been super interesting (they could be a bit difficult, but because we had a reasonable reading load, we got to dive into all of them deeply).

I loved how we were encouraged to link the topics of this class to our lives

I think the course was amazing, the syllabus was amazing, the discussions were so awesome, I loved coming to every class. I think it could have been improved by me understanding it faster, but that is user error, not a fault of Professor Lewis. It helped me reevaluate the ways that I listen and learn. The transisition between concepts was masterful!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Especially WGSS majors who have seen psychoanalytic concepts in readings and want to understand what they actually mean on a deeper level

Yes, this was an amazing course, it will teach you how to understand the world through understanding how you perceive it and how it affects you. I suggest that you don't take it lightly, and take your time with the material.
